intro: Phymatopteris chenkouensis, commonly known as the Chenzhou shield fern, is a rare and specialized fern species native to China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its unique, shield-shaped fronds that are tightly clustered. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, typical of many ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an important species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
